Package BobcatLib.Hardware.Encoders

Class CanCoderWrapper

java.lang.Object
BobcatLib.Hardware.Encoders.CanCoderWrapper
All Implemented Interfaces:
EncoderIO
public class CanCoderWrapper extends Object implements EncoderIO
A wrapper class for managing a CANcoder device, implementing the EncoderIO interface. This class handles configuration, fault checking, and interaction with the encoder.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface BobcatLib.Hardware.Encoders.EncoderIO

    EncoderIO.EncoderIOInputs

  • Constructor Details

    • CanCoderWrapper

      public CanCoderWrapper(CANDeviceDetails details, EncoderConstants chosenModule, String canivorename)
      Constructs a CanCoderWrapper instance.
      Parameters:
      details - Details of the CAN device, including its ID and name.
      chosenModule - The encoder constants for the chosen module.
      canivorename - The CANivore name to use for the device.

  • Method Details

    • configAbsEncoder

      public void configAbsEncoder()
      Configures the absolute encoder's sensor position and determines its inversion state. This method initializes the encoder based on the chosen module's configuration.
      Specified by:
      configAbsEncoder in interface EncoderIO

    • getAbsolutePosition

      public double getAbsolutePosition()
      Retrieves the absolute position of the encoder.
      Specified by:
      getAbsolutePosition in interface EncoderIO
      Returns:
      The absolute position of the encoder, as a rotation value in the range (-0.5 to 0.999999).

    • factoryDefault

      public void factoryDefault()
      Resets the encoder to its factory default configuration.
      Specified by:
      factoryDefault in interface EncoderIO

    • clearStickyFaults

      public void clearStickyFaults()
      Clears sticky faults on the encoder. Sticky faults are persistent errors that must be manually cleared.
      Specified by:
      clearStickyFaults in interface EncoderIO

    • checkForFaults

      public void checkForFaults()
      Checks for faults in the encoder. This method delegates fault checking to the CanCoderFaults instance.
      Specified by:
      checkForFaults in interface EncoderIO
